unsolved: Synchronizing users' browsing history across their devices
use_cases_desc:
The paper describes two scenarios where the system synchronizes the browsing history between a user's devices.

The first scenario describes a reading activity that started on-the-go on a smartphone and is continued on a laptop at home.

The second scenario is retrieving previously visited websites on another device.
contribution_desc: The paper presents a system enabling cross-device browsing. A user's browsing history is captured on all of their devices and securely stored on a remote server to make it available on all other devices. Apart from collecting URLs only, the paper also proposes a heuristic-based approach to extract salient features of a visited website alongside its URL (i.e., title and header of a page, a salient image, and the text surrounding the salient image). The paper also briefly describes how devices in different form factors should best display the browsing history.
